projectDesc.p: "擊梧桐" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the Tune “Strike the Parasol Tree”
The fragrant dimple is deep,
handsome and enchanting,
she has heavenly-endowed elegance and extraordinary beauty.
Ever since I met her,
I have been treating her with care,
and thus won over her bewitching heart.
Upon parting, we swore to share joy again,
and promised our lives to each other.
I am still afraid that our love
will be easily broken and hard to keep to the end.
I could not help but have a thousand thoughts and worries.
Recently, her letter came,
with only simple greetings.
There is no words of sorrow or earnest concern at all.
Thus, I am sure that
she must have listened to others,
planning to throw away previous promises.
I have heard of Song Yu, the Historian of the Orchid Terrace,
who was greatly talented and excelled in poems and rhapsodies.
I’d like to ask him,
every morning and every night,
where did the floating cloud go.
